Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Hart2011
Reviews.Content: This a warm and welcoming hotel. we travelled as two adults with adolescent children. The two bedroom apartment was spacious and comfortable, although the wifi struggled a bit and the kitchenware sparse. W agree with everyone else, a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Simon M
Reviews.Content: The food was great, We loved the fresh fruits and beautiful fresh flowers. People there were very friendly, and we felt well taken care of. This is a perfect place to see the sights of Berlin, we definately didn't need a car,as the bus and train and tram are all in walking distance. I give it a thumbs up ! Simon Hawaii, USA

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but get a room in the main hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajsam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent trip to Berlin, after staying at Hotel Amano in Berlin. This hotel is very different, more of a B&B than a hotel, no bar or restaurant. But a great location close to the tram stop and 5 minutes from Alexandrplatz. We stayed for 2 nights and the first room we were checked into was in apartment block on the street in a room which was probably only used when they were overfull, not great noisy and not really clean. We asked to be moved and moved for the second night into the main hotel, room on top floor but much better. Breakfast was very good, nice unusual choice of hot and cold food, but coffee not great. I am not sure that it is the best breakfast in Berlin! It is very good value, if you get a room in the main hotel. Also free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “A Cracking spot.Quiet.Tram stop outside,and a great breakfast served from 6am-12!”
Reviews.Author: Vantagepoint53
Reviews.Content: Took the M4 tram from Alexanderplatz station to Hufelandstr in 7mins. the hotel was across the road through a courtyard,which is why there is no noise from the street. Was checked in by friendly staff pretty fast.after a full days sightseeing,and a very relaxing sleep,in a clean and comfortable room,i went downstairs for breakfast,and as other reviews have said..it doesnt disappoint,it had the lot. I set off for Alexanderplatz station ,stuffed,but energetic for another days sightseeing,knowing that the hotel choice covered all my needs.If i was going back to berlin,then i wouldnt look any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Well Located and Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: mags2820
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 8 staying in 4 rooms for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location, just 3 tram stops from Alexanderplatz. Even though Greiswalerstrasse is not the most beautiful street in the world, it is adjacent to some lovely areas. Prinzlauer Berg is a very trendy part of Berlin with lots of good bars and restaurants. The hotel is situated back from the main street. The reception area is small and you reach your rooms through a long staircase - there is no lift. Our room was smallish and basic but was immaculately clean and quiet. The bed was large and comfy and we slept like the dead - though the cheap German beer helped! The bathroom was basic and clean with a powerful shower. Some of the staff do not speak English but we managed to understand each other. One English speaking staff member was very helpful - he recommended a fabulous local Vietnamese restaurant and paved the way for some of our party check out late with no extra charge. There is nothing fancy about this hotel - if you are looking for luxury, go somewhere else. But if you want a well priced, clean, quiet hotel in a good location, Hotel Greifswald fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Droblin
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Doesn't look much from the street, but looks can be deceiving. Our room was huge and luxurious with a really comfortable bed. Great buffet breakfast and helpful staff too. A little out of the way but worth the 15 min walk to Alexanderplatz. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely place, charming and friendly with the most comfortable beds...”
Reviews.Author: Emma3636
Reviews.Content: An absolute gem- we booked the Greifswald for my second trip to Berlin and my partner's first. The room was superb, even though we'd paid for the smaller size. The beds were incredibly comfortable, the room was clean and quiet, the bathroom had what looked like original GDR fittings and the staff were really helpful- to the point that when it was time to go home and we realised the bus we had taken from the airport on arrival wasn't running, one of the night staff looked up the best way for us to get there and left us detailed instructions and a U-Bahn timetable to collect in the morning. Very friendly, relaxed and comfortable- the breakfast is superb too and the location is perfect if you're not after commercial West Berlin- Prenzlauerberg is lovely and the restaurants and vintage shops are the best I've been to in a long time. We can't recommend this place enough- it's quite romantic too, in an East German way!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RicktrellesPTY
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Greifswald Berlin for a week and it was just great. The room was clean, and the hotel was located in a estrategic area. Just 10 minutes from Alexander Platz (walking distance) The breakfast is complete and fantastic. (Good variety of fruits, cereals, etc.) You must visit the portuguese restaurant near the hotel (the food is the best) The lady at the reception was nice and always advised me over restaurants and places... I will like to stay there next year if I travel again to Berlin (for sure!)

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast, lovely room, good location”
Reviews.Author: wanderingflower
Reviews.Content: We booked the Griefswald because of the reviews and the price and I'm so glad we did. In fact next time we go to Berlin we'll try and stay there again. I think we lucked out on the room as it was HUGE, lovely and light with an enormous comfy bed (very difficult not to crawl back in to it after stuffing our faces at breakfast) My boyfriend thought the bathroom was tiny but I didn't care, it was totally fine. The breakfast was great, lots of ham and cheese, as you'd expect, but also artichokes, smoked salmon, fritters, cake, omlette... and alot more. Yum. The staff were friendly and helpful too. We actually thought the location was pretty good too, its so quiet and there's a tram stop right outside which takes you to Alexanderplatz (pretty much the centre - v.touristy - and good travel connections to everywhere in Berlin) There's also a tram stop just up the road which takes you to Friedrichshain/east Kreuzberg (the best places for going out, so easy to get back from in the early hours) Prenzulauer Berg's lovely too, full of young familiies but also good bars/cafes and shops. Make sure you go to the flea markets on a Sunday, which is a 10 min walk away. We stayed west side on the last night and east side clearly rules.... the atmosphere is much livelier, younger and less commercial. I'm a sucker for graffiti too...

Reviews.Title: “Great value, love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonismyhome
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great hotel, friendly, clean, cheap and well-situated. We love the Greifswald so much we have stayed there 4 times between 2003 - 2008. As others say, breakfasts are fab, staff very friendly. The photos someone has put up here of the street are harsh - it isn't that bad! Anyway there's graffiti all over Berlin. Also if you are travelling around and need to wash clothes there's a fab internet/cafe/launderette nearby (2 mins, right out of the hotel). Rooms are smallish but comfy and endearingly basic (no minibar or all that stuff). As for its location - I prefer the East to the West and love pottering around Prenzlauerberg, which is full of lovely cafes, yummy mummies and greenery. I felt very safe in this area. Best I can do is attach photos I have taken over the years...and recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “German Bonhomie at the Greifswald!”
Reviews.Author: Hedleyman
Reviews.Content: We, a party of four 40-year-old blokes, recently spent 2 nights here and although we spent very little time in it, I am doing my TripAdvisor duty!. The hotel is located on a main road heading north-east from Alexanderplatz (the M4 tram will get you there in about 10 minutes) but as it is set well back from the street, the hotel itself is very quiet. It is built around a small courtyard which I'm sure is very pleasant to breakfast in during warmer weather. The reception/breakfast area has a certain rock music vibe to it as the hotel appears to cater for a lot of passing musicians playing the nearby Magnet or Knaack clubs. During our stay, reception staff were super-friendly and gave us Berlin virgins plenty of advice! I have to say that this friendliness extended to all of the locals we came across in the east of the city (I've never met nicer people on my travels). Both rooms were perfectly sized, pleasant ,and clean, with good bathrooms. Breakfast is an extra 7.50 euros but well worth it , and it is served until midday (a real bonus given that Berlin bars don't seem to close!). Based on our albeit quick Berlin taster, I would say that the old east Berlin is more "happening" if your holidays are more about bar-hopping and is the part of town I'll be heading back to in the not so distant future and I would happily return to the Greifswald.

Reviews.Title: “East Berlin.... if you need to stay in the East, pretty good little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lisacarol97
Reviews.Content: Ok where to begin.... just got back from a 2 night stay at the hotel greifswald in Berlin. I would really like to leave a positive review for this hotel, as the staff were very nice, and the room was pretty good, clean, comfy, quiet, etc. (Room 31 3rd floor) Unfortunately I have given the hotel a neutral/average rating, as its location really lets it down. It was quite a novelty to stay in East Berlin, and yes I felt pretty safe walking around with my boyfriend. But the depressing communist air is still very prominent in the East. There are no shopping/decent restaurants/etc in the area, only a few small off licences and some turkish fast food donner establishments. There is a tram stop right outside the hotel. I can't remember what is was called, but it is after Alexanderplaza and before the first greifswald street stop. Don't stay on till griefswald, you'll go too far! Basically after alexanderplaza keep your eyes open you'll see the green hotel awning and know to get off. Unfortunately for us, there was a transport strike on, so we had to walk everyday to Alexanderplaza to get an S train. It was about a 15 minute walk, not inspiring, very concrete massive wide roads. A taxi to Ostbanhoff (East Berlin station) was E7.80. We had breakfast both days, it was ok, I can't see why others are raving about it though, it is an extra E7.50 each per day. It has 3 varieties of muesli, milk, orange juice, and lots of cold salami/ham/cheese and fruit platters. There was also scrambled eggs on a hot plate covered which was not hot on either days, I still had them both days, on toast, but they were cold. There was also 3 types of bread available to toast. Good coffee and tea brought to your table as well. As I said, it was ok, I think it was worth the E7.50 as there is not places nearby to eat, and you can have a really big bowl of muesli and toast, etc. Overall it was a colorful experience staying here, as we felt like we saw communist berlin, but be sure the tram is running and you don't mind the ride in and out of town, as all Berlin tourist stuff is a tram ride away. Think about getting a city card from the train stations, it was 15.50E for 48 hours, unlimited zone a and b travel, and discounts at some tourist places, we didn't get the full worth as only limited transport available due to the strike, but there you go. We would not recommend this hotel to any tourists wanting to visit Berlin unless they were on a strict budget, or didn't mind the tram travel (check first!!), We would like to stress though that the hotel itself was comfortable and the staff very nice. There you go, hope this helps you make a decision....if it is only 10-20euros more to stay in West Berlin, my partner and I would pay the extra next time if we went back to Berlin. PS Check out the Zur Leztzen Instanz traditional pub in East Berlin, station stop Jerbowiz after Alexanderplatza, address 14-16 Weisserstraza (sp!) it was a nice typical hearty German meal! On a side street by a church, not touristy at all, looked like only locals knew about it, Very nice. Wooden panelled walls, visited by Napoleon, etc, Dates to 1621.Hope all this info helps you have a nice trip. Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget choice in colorful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: xeno111
Reviews.Content: Great budget choice in a great location - stayed several nights and enjoyed it greatly. Don't be scared off by the bizarre walk to the lobby - there's a charming hotel inside, with wonderful, friendly staff (although the overnight crew less so) and a monster breakfast buffet. On a block with transit options to get you to other parts of Berlin. Highly recommended. You have to walk a few blocks to find a good bar or sitdown restaurant, but it's a safe neighborhood and full of hidden surprises. And the staff was friendly, but not overly knowledgeable about nightlife. But that is what the Internet is for. Speaking of which, they have free wireless, but it is spotty on certain floors. Overall, you get a lot for your money here, and it has character you can't get at a big expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Matti-Pringle
Reviews.Content: If you read the Lonely Planet desciption of Hotel Greifswald one does not get the impression that the place is anthing special, which should just goes to show how subjective our experiences can be! In contrast, I was very much impressed by this gem of a hotel. There has been much fanfare in other reviews about the lavish breakfast spread, late check-out time and the cheery staff, which I would also happily second. However, the rooms are also worth a mention - I found them stylishly, albeit simply decorated, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The hotel's location is also a definite plus. Why break the bank looking for a place to stay in Berlin Mitte when hotels in this part of town (Prenzlauer Berg) can be reached from Alexanderplatz in a five minute tram ride or fifteen minute walk? In fact, I liked this place so much I am coming back for Easter with the love of my life!

Reviews.Title: “the best location in berlin”
Reviews.Author: joeDumfries
Reviews.Content: room was exellent large and clean very friendly and helpful staff great breakfast and good value for money. Been to Berlin many times and without a doubt this has been the best value for money

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, fantastic freshly made breakfasts, cakes galore”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSLondon
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff who man the hotel 24x7, fantastic freshly made breakfasts officially available until 12:30pm but I still had eggs and bacon made for me at 2pm. Was also offered home made cakes on top of everything else. Rooms simple but clean. Shower temperature a bit tricky to master. No lift. M4 Tram just outside to take you to Alexander Platz and Hackescher Markt (about 10mins). Taxi from Tegel Airport about 22 euros. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “My sanctuary in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Emma_and_Sid
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked some flights to Berlin and decided that we would search for a hotel a couple of weeks before we jetted off. I did some searches and everyone told me to stay in West Berlin. Looking at the sites and reading about Berlin, the East has more to appeal. I found this charming hotel and due to the reviews on tripadvisor, I emailed them straight away. I booked via email and the people were very helpful and informative. When we landed, they gave me directions to get there on the train and tram, these took us to the front door. We arrived slap bang in the middle of breakfast and although we should not be checking in until after 12, they sat us down and made us feel very welcome immediately. The hotel is as I had imagined it, full of character. There are some amazing little restaurants and bistros up side streets and the food and booze is remarkably cheap! After the most amazing breakfast I could have dreamed off (eggs, bacon, cheese, ham, cereal, toast, you name I ate it, fresh fruit the works!!!!!) we set off. Due to the immense breakfast, no lunch was needed, just some fruit from the several 100 stand around the city. When we returned late at nigh, we could grab a couple of beers from the off licence round the corner and enjoy them sat in the peaceful courtyard. As we were out early and in late (with a quick stop off in the afternoon) the hotel is a stone throws away from the city centre, a couple of stops on the tram. The trams are so regular that there is no need to worry about anything. The city is extremely relaxed and the hotel reflects this. We are going back this year-it is my little paradise a facinating city.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that (almost) came in from the cold”
Reviews.Author: Burdenben
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Greifswald at about midnight. The graffiti strewn street in which the hotel is located contains a dance club and the local headquarters of the ' Hells Angels' , but that didn't affect our stay in the former GDR capital other than in a positive sense. If you have mobility problems of any sort, or just don't care for long flights of stairs this is not the hotel for you. Also the photos give the impression of large spacious rooms, whereas the reality is somewhat different (and considerably smaller). All of the reviews mention the quality and quantity of the breakfasts at this hotel, and they are good. A massive choice of everything from fruit to scrambled egg, fresh orange juice and coffee really set you up for the day. The hotel is in a pretty good position on the M4 tram route into Alexanderplatz (buy a ticket on the tram with coins -5.80 euros for a day ticket) and from there it's a pleasant walk along Unter Den Linden to the museums and Art Galleries along with the Brandenburg Tor. There are a large number of nearby restaurants all of which were good value for money and provided a lot of choice. The area is also the focus of a lively arts scene at the local Culture Brewery Arts Centre. There is a lot to do and see in the Eastern side of Berlin- such that we rarely ventured ' over there' (to the West - as the locals refer to it despite the wall having come down in 1989). There is a lot of history deeply relevant to our times dotted all around within walking distance of the hotel. This part of Berlin is cheap and that should temper expectations, but even so standards are not bad and considerably better than you would find in a UK city of equivalent size. A fair amount of the film 'Goodbye Lenin' was shot around here particularly around Molstrasse and Otto Braun Strasse - thus those seeking a little 'Ostalgia' won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good breakfast, near a tram stop.”
Reviews.Author: Headjoint
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in the Hotel Greifswald because of the comments on this site about the breakfast. It kept me going all morning as I walked around the city. They give you a choice of teas too! The hotel isn't like the modern NH type places but it is in an older building with character. I like to use public transport and the M4 tram stops a few metres from the entrance. The M4 line takes you to Alexanderplatz in a few minutes. Communication via e-mail in English was quick and they put me on the ground floor when I wrote to tell them I had a sprained ankle. I'm not sure if they have a lift because my room was an apartment 10 metres from the hotel entrance. It had a kitchen area where I could eat a takeaway meal. The heating in December worked fine and the bed was comfortable (I'm 1.92 tall). If I win the lottery this Christmas I will stay at the Adlon Hotel next time. However, if I don't get lucky I'll be happy to go back to the Hotel Greifswald.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Mandy-in-London
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed here and we all loved it. Very well located for both sightseeing and nightlife. Clean, comfortable rooms and the most fantastic breakfast. Very friendly staff. No lift. The only down side was that our room was at the back overlooking a noisy factory so during the week we were woken very early but at the weekend it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the Best Breakfast Around!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked a bit dated from the outside, however once though the doors the hotel itself certainly wasn't.... the staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help, orgainising taxis, restaurants etc. The rooms were spotlessly clean and warm even though it was -4 degrees outside you'd never have guessed. But the best bit about the hotel was the breakfast - its fabulous, hams, cheeses, bread, cereals etc etc and if you fancy a long lie in its served until 1pm. There is also a very nice bar about 30m down the road towards Alexanderplatz - a bit odd as it doubles as a launderette, but the prices are very reasonable, good place for a night cap?? Would recommend getting the hop on hop off bus for a good tour of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitty26
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, warm and cosy. (5 flights of stairs though) Staff very friendly and helpful, amazing breakfast that sets you up for the day. I would definitely stay here again, very good value. Very quiet area, possibly a bit too quiet for me. The market on Saturday in Kowilltzplatz is well worth a wander round.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: handpt
Reviews.Content: Tucked away off the street and only a few meters from the street car stop this hotel may seem a little worn at first glance but the rooms are very clean and quiet. I found the hotel staff very friendly and willng to serve. But what a breakfast!!! Eggs, ham, sauage, smoked sallmon, mediteranean veggies, home made cakes just for starters. The hotel staff says that this is the breakfast you look forward to all day-and they mean it. Located in a neighborhood that is being gentrified-lots of restaurants in walking distance.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Greifswald
HotelInfo.Address: Greifswalder Strasse 211 | Prenzlauer Berg, 10405 Berlin, Germany
